Word Description: Noun or verb meaning plan or project.
Conversation Japanese: A: プロジェクトの計画、どうなりましたか？ B: 今週中にまとめます。
Conversation Romaji: A: Purojekuto no keikaku, dō narimashita ka? B: Konshū-chū ni matomemasu.
Conversation Translation: A: How is the project plan coming along? B: I'll finalize it by the end of this week.

Word Description: Noun or verb meaning plan or project.
Conversation Japanese: A: 今日の開発の計画は？ B: まず新しい機能を実装します。
Conversation Romaji: A: Kyō no kaihatsu no keikaku wa? B: Mazu atarashii kinō o jissō shimasu.
Conversation Translation: A: What's the development plan for today? B: First, we'll implement the new feature.

Word Description: Noun or verb meaning plan or project.
Conversation Japanese: A: 会議の計画を変更してもいいですか？ B: ええ、大丈夫ですよ。
Conversation Romaji: A: Kaigi no keikaku o henkō shite mo ii desu ka? B: Ee, daijōbu desu yo.
Conversation Translation: A: Is it okay to change the plan for the meeting? B: Yes, that's fine.

Word Description: Noun or verb meaning plan or project.
Conversation Japanese: A: このリリースの計画で進めましょう。 B: はい、異議ありません。
Conversation Romaji: A: Kono rirīsu no keikaku de susumemashō. B: Hai, igi arimasen.
Conversation Translation: A: Let's proceed with this release plan. B: Yes, I have no objection.

Word Description: Noun or verb meaning plan or project.
Conversation Japanese: A: 次の四半期の計画を話し合いましょう。 B: いつ頃がご都合よろしいですか？
Conversation Romaji: A: Tsugi no shihanki no keikaku o hanashiaimashō. B: Itsu goro ga go-tsugō yoroshii desu ka?
Conversation Translation: A: Let's discuss the plan for the next quarter. B: Around when is convenient for you?

Word Description: schedule
Conversation Japanese: Common noun or suru-verb indicating a plan or schedule.
Conversation Romaji: A: 明日の会議の予定は？ B: 10時からです。
Conversation Translation: A: Ashita no kaigi no yotei wa? B: Juu-ji kara desu.
column8: A: What's the schedule for tomorrow's meeting? B: It's from 10 o'clock.

Word Description: schedule
Conversation Japanese: Common noun or suru-verb indicating a plan or schedule.
Conversation Romaji: A: このプロジェクトの完了予定はいつですか？ B: 来月末の予定です。
Conversation Translation: A: Kono purojekuto no kanryou yotei wa itsu desu ka? B: Raigetsu matsu no yotei desu.
column8: A: When is the planned completion date for this project? B: It's scheduled for the end of next month.

Word Description: schedule
Conversation Japanese: Common noun or suru-verb indicating a plan or schedule.
Conversation Romaji: A: 今日の午後の予定は空いていますか？ B: はい、特に予定はありません。
Conversation Translation: A: Kyou no gogo no yotei wa aite imasu ka? B: Hai, tokuni yotei wa arimasen.
column8: A: Is your afternoon schedule free today? B: Yes, I don't have any particular plans.

Word Description: schedule
Conversation Japanese: Common noun or suru-verb indicating a plan or schedule.
Conversation Romaji: A: サーバーメンテナンスの予定は変更になりましたか？ B: いいえ、今のところ変更の予定はありません。
Conversation Translation: A: Saabaa menatenansu no yotei wa henkou ni narimashita ka? B: Iie, ima no tokoro henkou no yotei wa arimasen.
column8: A: Has the server maintenance schedule changed? B: No, there are no plans for changes at the moment.

Word Description: schedule
Conversation Japanese: Common noun or suru-verb indicating a plan or schedule.
Conversation Romaji: A: 新機能のリリース予定は？ B: 来週の金曜日を予定しています。
Conversation Translation: A: Shinkinou no ririisu yotei wa? B: Raishuu no kinyoubi o yotei shite imasu.
column8: A: What's the planned release date for the new feature? B: We're planning for next Friday.

Word Description: Common verb meaning to offer or supply.
Conversation Japanese: A: 新しいクラウドサービス、いつから提供できますか？ B: 来月から提供開始できる見込みです。
Conversation Romaji: A: Atarashii kuraudo sābisu, itsu kara teikyō dekimasu ka? B: Raigetsu kara teikyō kaishi dekiru mikomi desu.
Conversation Translation: A: When can we start providing the new cloud service? B: We expect to be able to start providing it from next month.

Word Description: Common verb meaning to offer or supply.
Conversation Japanese: A: クライアントに提供する資料、これで大丈夫ですか？ B: はい、必要な情報は全て提供されています。
Conversation Romaji: A: Kuraianto ni teikyō suru shiryō, kore de daijōbu desu ka? B: Hai, hitsuyō na jōhō wa subete teikyō sarete imasu.
Conversation Translation: A: Are these materials okay to provide to the client? B: Yes, all the necessary information is provided.

Word Description: Common verb meaning to offer or supply.
Conversation Japanese: A: お客様への技術サポートは誰が提供しますか？ B: 私たちのチームが提供します。
Conversation Romaji: A: Okyakusama e no gijutsu sapōto wa dare ga teikyō shimasu ka? B: Watashitachi no chīmu ga teikyō shimasu.
Conversation Translation: A: Who will provide technical support to the customers? B: Our team will provide it.

Word Description: Common verb meaning to offer or supply.
Conversation Japanese: A: このシステムはどのような機能を提供しますか？ B: データ分析とレポート作成機能を提供します。
Conversation Romaji: A: Kono shisutemu wa dono yō na kinō o teikyō shimasu ka? B: Dēta bunseki to repōto sakusei kinō o teikyō shimasu.
Conversation Translation: A: What kind of functions does this system provide? B: It provides data analysis and report creation functions.

Word Description: Common verb meaning to offer or supply.
Conversation Japanese: A: 御社へ最適なソリューションを提供させていただきます。 B: ありがとうございます。詳しい内容を聞かせてください。
Conversation Romaji: A: Onsha e saiteki na soryūshon o teikyō sa sete itadakimasu. B: Arigatō gozaimasu. Kuwashii naiyō o kikasete kudasai.
Conversation Translation: A: We would like to provide the optimal solution for your company. B: Thank you very much. Please tell us the details.

Word Description: Describes something as fundamental or basic; functions as a na-adjective.
Conversation Japanese: A: このバグ、なかなか直りませんね。 B: ええ、これは単なるエラーではなく、システムの根本的な設計に問題があるようです。
Conversation Romaji: A: Kono bagu, nakanaka naorimasen ne. B: Ee, kore wa tan naru erā de wa naku, shisutemu no konponteki na sekkei ni mondai ga aru yō desu.
Conversation Translation: A: This bug is hard to fix, isn't it? B: Yes, it seems this isn't just a simple error, but a fundamental problem with the system's design.

Word Description: Describes something as fundamental or basic; functions as a na-adjective.
Conversation Japanese: A: プロジェクトの遅延が続いていますが、原因は何でしょうか？ B: 根本的な原因は、私たちのワークフローに非効率な部分が多いことだと思います。改善が必要です。
Conversation Romaji: A: Purojekuto no chien ga tsuzuite imasu ga, gen'in wa nan deshō ka? B: Konponteki na gen'in wa, watashitachi no wākurō ni hiefficient na bubun ga ooi koto da to omoimasu. Kaizen ga hitsuyō desu.
Conversation Translation: A: The project delays are continuing, what could be the cause? B: I think the fundamental cause is that there are many inefficient parts in our workflow. Improvement is necessary.

Word Description: Describes something as fundamental or basic; functions as a na-adjective.
Conversation Japanese: A: 来期の売上目標、達成できるか心配です。 B: 今までのやり方では難しいかもしれません。根本的な戦略の変更を検討しましょう。
Conversation Romaji: A: Raiki no uriage mokuhyō, tassei dekiru ka shinpai desu. B: Ima made no yarikata de wa muzukashii kamo shiremasen. Konponteki na senryaku no henkō o kentō shimashō.
Conversation Translation: A: I'm worried if we can achieve next term's sales target. B: It might be difficult with the current approach. Let's consider a fundamental change in strategy.

Word Description: Describes something as fundamental or basic; functions as a na-adjective.
Conversation Japanese: A: この機能、なぜユーザーに受け入れられないのでしょう？ B: プロジェクト開始時に、ユーザーニーズの根本的な理解が不足していたのかもしれません。
Conversation Romaji: A: Kono kinō, naze yūzā ni ukeirerarenai no deshō? B: Purojekuto kaishi-ji ni, yūzā nīzu no konponteki na rikai ga fusoku shite ita no kamo shiremasen.
Conversation Translation: A: Why isn't this feature being accepted by users? B: At the start of the project, there might have been a fundamental lack of understanding of user needs.

Word Description: Describes something as fundamental or basic; functions as a na-adjective.
Conversation Japanese: A: 最近、エラーが多いのですが、どうすれば減らせますか？ B: チーム全体のコーディングスキルの根本的な向上に取り組む必要があるかもしれません。
Conversation Romaji: A: Saikin, erā ga ooi no desu ga, dō sureba herasemasu ka? B: Chīmu zentai no kōdingu sukiru no konponteki na kōjō ni torikumu hitsuyō ga aru kamo shiremasen.
Conversation Translation: A: Recently, there have been many errors, how can we reduce them? B: We might need to work on a fundamental improvement of the entire team's coding skills.

Word Description: Adjectival noun. Describes something specific or tangible.
Conversation Japanese: A:このプロジェクトの要件、もっと具体的に教えてもらえますか？ B:はい、来週までに詳細なドキュメントを作成します。
Conversation Romaji: A:Kono purojekuto no yōken, motto gutaiteki ni oshiete moraemasu ka? B:Hai, raishū made ni shōsaina dokyumento o sakusei shimasu.
Conversation Translation: A:Could you please tell me the requirements for this project more specifically? B:Yes, I will create a detailed document by next week.

Word Description: Adjectival noun. Describes something specific or tangible.
Conversation Japanese: A:そのバグ修正、具体的にいつまでに完了しますか？ B:テストを含めて、明日中に対応できると思います。
Conversation Romaji: A:Sono bagu shūsei, gutaiteki ni itsu made ni kanryō shimasu ka? B:Tesuto o fukumete, asu-jū ni taiō dekiru to omoimasu.
Conversation Translation: A:Specifically, by when will that bug fix be completed? B:Including testing, I think I can handle it by tomorrow.

Word Description: Adjectival noun. Describes something specific or tangible.
Conversation Japanese: A:顧客からのフィードバック、具体的な内容はありますか？ B:はい、特にパフォーマンスに関する指摘が多かったです。
Conversation Romaji: A:Kokyaku kara no fīdobakku, gutaiteki na naiyō wa arimasu ka? B:Hai, tokuni pafōmansu ni kansuru shiteki ga ōkatta desu.
Conversation Translation: A:Is there any specific content in the feedback from the customer? B:Yes, there were many points raised specifically about performance.

Word Description: Adjectival noun. Describes something specific or tangible.
Conversation Japanese: A:ミーティングの結果を受けて、具体的な次のステップは何ですか？ B:まずは担当者を決めて、タスクリストを作成します。
Conversation Romaji: A:Mītingu no kekka o ukete, gutaiteki na tsugi no suteppu wa nan desu ka? B:Mazu wa tantōsha o kimete, tasuku risuto o sakusei shimasu.
Conversation Translation: A:Following the meeting results, what are the specific next steps? B:First, we will decide on who is in charge and create a task list.

Word Description: Adjectival noun. Describes something specific or tangible.
Conversation Japanese: A:そのレポートのデータ、もう少し具体的に説明してもらえませんか？ B:はい、どの期間のデータにご興味がありますか？
Conversation Romaji: A:Sono repōto no dēta, mō sukoshi gutaiteki ni setsumei shite moraemasen ka? B:Hai, dono kikan no dēta ni gokyōmi ga arimasu ka?
Conversation Translation: A:Could you explain the data in that report a little more specifically? B:Yes, which period's data are you interested in?

Word Description: Adjectival noun (な-adjective) indicating the final state or outcome.
Conversation Japanese: A: デザインはこれで最終的ですか？ B: いいえ、まだ少し修正が必要です。
Conversation Romaji: A: Dezain wa kore de saishūteki desu ka? B: Iie, mada sukoshi shūsei ga hitsuyō desu.
Conversation Translation: A: Is this the final design? B: No, a little more modification is still needed.

Word Description: Adjectival noun (な-adjective) indicating the final state or outcome.
Conversation Japanese: A: このタスクの最終的な締め切りはいつですか？ B: 来週の水曜日までにお願いします。
Conversation Romaji: A: Kono tasuku no saishūteki na shimekiri wa itsu desu ka? B: Raishū no suiyōbi made ni onegai shimasu.
Conversation Translation: A: When is the final deadline for this task? B: Please finish it by next Wednesday.

Word Description: Adjectival noun (な-adjective) indicating the final state or outcome.
Conversation Japanese: A: 使用するフレームワークは最終的に決まりましたか？ B: はい、Reactを使うことになりました。
Conversation Romaji: A: Shiyō suru furēmuwāku wa saishūteki ni kimarimashita ka? B: Hai, React o tsukau koto ni narimashita.
Conversation Translation: A: Has the framework to use finally been decided? B: Yes, it has been decided to use React.

Word Description: Adjectival noun (な-adjective) indicating the final state or outcome.
Conversation Japanese: A: プロジェクトの最終報告書はいつ提出しますか？ B: 明日中には提出できると思います。
Conversation Romaji: A: Purojekuto no saishū hōkokusho wa itsu teishutsu shimasu ka? B: Ashita-chū ni wa teishutsu dekiru to omoimasu.
Conversation Translation: A: When will you submit the final project report? B: I think I can submit it by tomorrow.

Word Description: Adjectival noun (な-adjective) indicating the final state or outcome.
Conversation Japanese: A: 最終的なテスト結果はどうでしたか？ B: いくつか小さなバグが見つかりました。
Conversation Romaji: A: Saishūteki na tesuto kekka wa dō deshita ka? B: Ikutsuka chiisana bagu ga mitsukarimashita.
Conversation Translation: A: How were the final test results? B: A few small bugs were found.
